pageContext.claim: “To me, he [Richard Bright] seems like a disgruntled employee that's trying to help the Democrats win an election by getting out. I mean, he's got a pre-taped sermon about, you know, what he thinks. And I can tell you they didn't think he did a very particularly good job, as I understand it.”
pageContext.analysis: Richard Bright, head of the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority since 2016, is a whistleblower who says his early warnings about the coronavirus were ignored and that his reluctance to make "potentially harmful drugs" available for treating covid-19, including hydroxychloroquine touted by Trump, led to his firing. The Office of Special Counsel, investigating his dismissal, told his lawyers a preliminary assessment found there are grounds to believe he had been removed as retaliation.
